Identification.LongTitle: Order Authorizing the Maximum Amounts That May Be Paid in the Year 1990 as Benefits Under Sections 24, 25 and 26 of the Unemployment Insurance Act

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Employment and Immigration and the Treasury Board, pursuant to subsections 24(4), 25(10) and 26(8) of the Unemployment Insurance Act, is pleased hereby to make the annexed Order authorizing the maximum amounts that may be paid in the year 1990 as benefits under sections 24, 25 and 26 of the Unemployment Insurance Act, effective January 1, 1990.

Section.Text: This Order may be cited as the Unemployment Insurance Benefits Order, 1990.
The maximum amounts that may be paid in the year 1990 as benefits under sections 24, 25 and 26 of the Unemployment Insurance Act, are $130,000,000, $120,000,000 and $376,000,000 respectively.
